page.title: 15The Dams
page.content: Carron Ironworks was the biggest{ {industry} in the area. It is now in the hands of the receiver who is selling the buildings, but as yet has not been able to sell the area known as the Dams -a large{lake}or resevoir of water used by the company. "In the lake there are two swans who have cygnets. The reeds are black. There is plenty of space to explore round and plenty of animals for the nature lover. There are little pools with fish in them where Carron Works dumped their slag to the south of the Dams. There are lots of rabbit warrens there, and lots of trees and bushes. It would make a good{nature reserve} ."It is already a good nature reserve -though, when the Dams were drained and the lake reduced in size, the balance of wildlife changed as the {environment}became marshy.
